issue: Analog Input Ch 1: Signal lost or static at 0V
solution: Check cable continuity for Channel 1 sensor. Tighten the connector at the DAQ port.

issue: Analog Input Ch 1: Signal clipping at max range
solution: Input voltage exceeds ±10V range. Check sensor sensitivity or gain settings for Channel 1.

issue: Analog Input Ch 1: High noise floor detected
solution: Inspect shield grounding for Channel 1. Ensure cable is not running near high-voltage lines.

issue: Analog Input Ch 1: Bias voltage out of spec (IEPE)
solution: Sensor open circuit or internal constant current source fault on Channel 1. Replace sensor.

issue: Analog Input Ch 1: Cross-talk from adjacent channel
solution: Isolate the signal cable for Channel 1. Check for shared ground loops with Channel 2.

issue: Analog Input Ch 2: Signal lost or static at 0V
solution: Check cable continuity for Channel 2 sensor. Tighten the connector at the DAQ port.

issue: Analog Input Ch 2: Signal clipping at max range
solution: Input voltage exceeds ±10V range. Check sensor sensitivity or gain settings for Channel 2.

issue: Analog Input Ch 2: High noise floor detected
solution: Inspect shield grounding for Channel 2. Ensure cable is not running near high-voltage lines.

issue: Analog Input Ch 2: Bias voltage out of spec (IEPE)
solution: Sensor open circuit or internal constant current source fault on Channel 2. Replace sensor.

issue: Analog Input Ch 2: Cross-talk from adjacent channel
solution: Isolate the signal cable for Channel 2. Check for shared ground loops with Channel 1/3.

issue: Temp Sensor Ch 1: Open circuit/broken wire
solution: Check for broken wire in PT100/RTD cable. Verify terminal tightness on Channel 1.

issue: Temp Sensor Ch 1: Short circuit detected
solution: Temperature reading stuck at max value. Inspect cable insulation for damage on Channel 1.

issue: Temp Sensor Ch 1: Value drifting unexpectedly
solution: Check for moisture in the sensor head or loose connection on Channel 1.

solution: Check for broken wire in PT100/RTD cable. Verify terminal tightness on Channel 2.

Too many error frames detected. Check termination resistors (120Ω) on both ends of CAN 1.
Device is receiving errors but not disrupting traffic. Check for baud rate mismatch on CAN 1.
Signal integrity issue. Use twisted pair shielded cable for CAN 1 wiring.
Too many error frames detected. Check termination resistors (120Ω) on both ends of CAN 2.
Device is receiving errors but not disrupting traffic. Check for baud rate mismatch on CAN 2.
Signal integrity issue. Use twisted pair shielded cable for CAN 2 wiring.
Cable disconnected or switch port dead. Try replacing the CAT6 cable on LAN 1.
Force the correct link speed in OS settings or check switch auto-negotiation.
Cable disconnected or switch port dead. Try replacing the CAT6 cable on LAN 2.
Force the correct link speed in OS settings or check switch auto-negotiation.
Incorrect WPA2 password. Update `wpa_supplicant.conf` with valid credentials.
Static IP assigned to Wi-Fi adapter is already in use. Switch to DHCP.
Thermal throttling active. Check fan operation and clean heatsink vents.
Available memory low. Stop non-essential Docker containers or upgrade RAM.
Check SATA power and data cables. Verify filesystem integrity (fsck).
Reseat the M.2 drive in the slot. Check BIOS settings for PCIe configuration.
24V PSU is sagging under load. Check PSU rating and wire gauge.
Overvoltage protection active. Regulate the DC supply to 24V.
Check reflective tape alignment or proximity sensor gap.
Ensure the tachometer cable is shielded. Check for vibrations affecting sensor mount.
Check wiring to the receiving PLC/Drive. Ensure the loop is closed.
Load impedance too low for voltage output. Check spec compliance.
Check wiring to the receiving PLC/Drive. Ensure the loop is closed.
Load impedance too low for voltage output. Check spec compliance.
Model taking too long to process. Reduce input batch size or simplify model.
Model file corrupted. Re-upload the .tflite or .onnx file.
Network latency too high. Refresh the page or check LAN connection.
Server internal error. Check application logs for stack trace.

issue: Vibration sensor X-axis signal lost, value static at 0
solution: Check the cable continuity for the X-axis accelerometer. Tighten the connector at the DAQ port.

issue: Vibration sensor Y-axis readings showing high noise floor
solution: Inspect the sensor mounting for looseness. Ensure the shield wire is properly grounded to the machine chassis.

issue: Z-axis accelerometer data clipping at maximum range
solution: The machine vibration exceeds the sensor's g-range. Verify if the correct sensor sensitivity is configured in settings.

issue: PT100 temperature sensor 1 showing negative value or open circuit
solution: Check for a broken wire in the RTD cable or loose terminal block connection on the TMM module.

issue: Temperature sensor 2 reading stuck at 850°C (Max Scale)
solution: Possible short circuit in the sensor wires. Inspect the cable insulation for damage.

issue: Hall effect current sensor giving non-zero reading when machine is off
solution: Perform a zero-calibration in the software settings. Check for magnetic interference near the sensor.

issue: DAQ ADC initialization failed on startup
solution: Power cycle the device. If the issue persists, the ADC chip may be damaged.
The configured sampling rate (e.g., 20kHz) is not supported by the current active channel count. Lower the sampling rate.

issue: Buffer overflow - Data acquisition speed exceeds processing speed
solution: Reduce the number of active channels or increase the buffer size in the configuration file.

issue: FFT calculation error: Time domain data corrupted
solution: Check for intermittent signal loss during the sampling window. Restart the edge processing service.

issue: Wi-Fi module initialized but unable to obtain IP address
solution: Check the DHCP server settings on the router. Verify the Wi-Fi password in the `wifi_config.json` file.

issue: Ethernet link down despite cable connected
solution: Try a different Ethernet cable. Ensure the switch port is active and not disabled.
Ping the broker URL from the device. Check firewall rules allowing traffic on port 1883/8883.

issue: Cloud sync failed: Authentication token expired
solution: Regenerate the device token from the cloud dashboard and update it in the device settings.

issue: Gateway reachable but no internet access
solution: Check the DNS settings. Ensure the gateway has a valid WAN connection.
Check the 24V DC power supply unit. Ensure the wiring gauge is sufficient for the distance.
Ensure the electrical cabinet fan is working. Check if the device heatsink is covered by dust.
Eject the SD card and unlock the physical write-protect switch. Reinsert and reboot.

issue: Local storage full: Unable to save CSV logs
solution: Delete old log files or enable 'Auto-delete oldest' in the storage settings.

issue: Modbus RS485 communication timeout with Energy Meter
solution: Check the twisted pair wiring (A/B). Verify Baud rate and Slave ID match the meter configuration.

issue: CRC error on Energy Meter data packet
solution: Check for electrical noise on the RS485 line. Install a termination resistor (120Ω) if the cable is long.
Check the system logs (`/var/log/syslog`) for the crash reason. Restart the service manually.

issue: Config file parsing error: invalid JSON format
solution: Restore the default configuration file or use a JSON validator to fix syntax errors.
Download the firmware file again. Ensure the connection is stable during upload.

issue: Web dashboard not loading: Port 80/8080 busy
solution: Another application might be using the port. Change the web server port in settings and restart.
Adjust the proximity sensor gap. Clean the reflective tape if using an optical sensor.
Check if the threshold value is set too low for the current cutting process. Recalibrate the baseline.

issue: Vibration sensor cable impedance too high
solution: Possible corrosion on the connector pins. Clean with contact cleaner or replace the cable.
The internal board sensor is malfunctioning. This may require a board replacement.

issue: Trigger signal not received for data capture
solution: Check the digital input (DI) wiring from the machine CNC controller (Cycle Start signal).
The internal constant current source (4mA) is not working. Check if the sensor requires external power.
Power off, remove the SIM card, clean the contacts, and reinsert it firmly.
Install an external Wi-Fi antenna or move the device closer to the access point.

issue: RTC (Real Time Clock) battery low, time lost on reboot
solution: Replace the CR2032 coin cell battery on the mainboard to retain system time.

issue: USB Drive not recognized for data export
solution: Format the USB drive to FAT32. NTFS is often not supported by embedded Linux devices.

issue: Energy meter Voltage phase sequence error
solution: Swap the L1 and L3 voltage sensing wires to correct the phase rotation.

issue: Power factor reading is NaN or invalid
solution: Current flow is too low to calculate Power Factor. Ensure the machine is under load.
The internal SQLite database is locked. Reboot the device to clear the lock file.
The processing thread is hung. Restart the device. If frequent, check CPU usage statistics.
Increase the chatter threshold. Review the frequency band settings for the specific tool.
Adjust the 'Machine On' vibration threshold. It is currently set higher than the idle vibration.

issue: Cross-talk detected between Channel 1 and Channel 2
solution: Separate the signal cables. Ensure analog cables are not running parallel to high-voltage power lines.
Check for loose wiring or moisture ingress in the sensor connector.
Power supply ripple is too high. Use a regulated UPS or noise filter for the power input.

issue: Device IP conflict detected on network
solution: Another device has the same static IP. Change the device IP or switch to DHCP.
Verify the SSH keys or password. Ensure SSH is enabled in the admin panel.
Check the ribbon cable connecting the LED panel to the mainboard.
The requested register address does not exist in the Energy Meter map. Update the Modbus map.
Contact support to renew the license. Upload the new `license.key` file.
Insufficient historical data to calculate wear. Run the machine for at least 10 cycles to build a baseline.
Check the wiring to the PLC analog input. Ensure the loop is powered.
Tap the relay lightly. If it remains stuck, the relay contact might be welded; replace the module.

issue: Accelerometer bias voltage out of spec
solution: The sensor might be damaged due to shock/drop. Replace the accelerometer.
The software debounce setting for the alarm is too high. Lower the hysteresis value.

issue: Data packet loss during high-speed streaming
solution: Network bandwidth is insufficient. Switch from Wi-Fi to Ethernet or reduce the data rate.
The device cannot reach the time server. Check internet access or specify a local NTP server IP.
The system was unresponsive and rebooted automatically. Monitor for recurring freeze patterns.
Check the machine for mechanical jamming or motor stalling events.

issue: User login failed: Max attempts exceeded
solution: Wait for 15 minutes for the lockout to clear or reset the admin password using the physical reset button.
Immediate inspection required. Vibration levels are significantly above the trained model's safe zone.
